descriptive_name: Complex compounds of manganese N,N'-ethylenebis(dithiocarbamate) and zinc N,N'-ethylenebis(dithiocarbamate)

acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.073mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the absence of mortality at the highest dose of 5.08mg/L in rat inhalation studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no evidence of treatment-related incidence of tumor formation observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=1.33(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: thermally decomposes at 190degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as flammable according to ICSC (2003)

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro studies (reverse mutation tests, chromosome aberration tests and DNA repair tests) and in vivo studies (mouse micronucleus tests and rat chromosome aberration tests) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987, 1993)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine, fluorine and oxygen

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on test data from rabbit eye irritation studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)): "Caused mild irritation of the eye, with effects resolving within 7 days."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on test data from rabbit skin corrosivity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)): "Erythematous responses were noted immediately after the application, but the affected animals exhibited scores of 0 at 72 hours."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization studies using the Buehler and Maximization methods (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987, 1993)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 6 plus or minus 3ppm, Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 2 (nervous system, thyroid, liver, adrenal gland)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system, thyroid, liver, adrenal gland)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including vacuolization/phagocytosis of myelin sheath, Schwann cell proliferation, increased thyroid weights, proliferation of follicular epithelium of the thyroid gland, hepatocellular hypertrophy, hypertrophy of basophilic cells of anterior lobe of hypophysis, and hypertrophy of adrenal cortical glomerulosa cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993, 2004)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: No symptoms or signs referable to specific target organs were observed at dose levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2 in the available single dose toxicity studies in rats and mice (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).
